description: Returns information about the table, including the table's name and current status, the keyspace name, configuration settings, and metadata. To read table metadata using GetTable, the IAM principal needs Select action permissions for the table and the system keyspace.

parameters.name: keyspaceName
parameters.description: The name of the keyspace that the table is stored in.

nested_items.name: keyspaceName
nested_items.description: The name of the keyspace that the specified table is stored in.

nested_items.name: tableName
nested_items.description: The name of the specified table.

nested_items.name: resourceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specified table.

nested_items.name: creationTimestamp
nested_items.description: The creation timestamp of the specified table.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The current status of the specified table.

nested_items.name: schemaDefinition
nested_items.description: The schema definition of the specified table.

nested_items.name: allColumns
nested_items.description: The regular columns of the table.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the column.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The data type of the column. For a list of available data types, see Data types in the Amazon Keyspaces Developer Guide.

nested_items.name: partitionKeys
nested_items.description: The columns that are part of the partition key of the table .

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name(s) of the partition key column(s).

nested_items.name: clusteringKeys
nested_items.description: The columns that are part of the clustering key of the table.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name(s) of the clustering column(s).

nested_items.name: orderBy
nested_items.description: Sets the ascendant ( ASC) or descendant ( DESC) order modifier.

nested_items.name: staticColumns
nested_items.description: The columns that have been defined as STATIC. Static columns store values that are shared by all rows in the same partition.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the static column.

nested_items.name: capacitySpecification
nested_items.description: The read/write throughput capacity mode for a table. The options are:
throughputMode:PAY_PER_REQUEST.
throughputMode:PROVISIONED.

nested_items.name: encryptionSpecification
nested_items.description: The encryption settings of the specified table.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The encryption option specified for the table. You can choose one of the following KMS keys (KMS keys):
type:AWS_OWNED_KMS_KEY - This key is owned by Amazon Keyspaces.

type:CUSTOMER_MANAGED_KMS_KEY - This key is stored in your account and is created, owned, and managed by you. This option requires the kms_key_identifier of the KMS key in Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format as input.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyIdentifier
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the customer managed KMS key, for example kms_key_identifier:ARN.

nested_items.name: pointInTimeRecovery
nested_items.description: The point-in-time recovery status of the specified table.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: Shows if point-in-time recovery is enabled or disabled for the specified table.

nested_items.name: earliestRestorableTimestamp
nested_items.description: Specifies the earliest possible restore point of the table in ISO 8601 format.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: Shows how to enable custom Time to Live (TTL) settings for the specified table.

nested_items.name: defaultTimeToLive
nested_items.description: The default Time to Live settings in seconds of the specified table.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: An optional description of the table.

nested_items.name: clientSideTimestamps
nested_items.description: The client-side timestamps setting of the table.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: Shows how to enable client-side timestamps settings for the specified table.

nested_items.name: replicaSpecifications
nested_items.description: Returns the Amazon Web Services Region specific settings of all Regions a multi-Region table is replicated in.

nested_items.name: region
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the multi-Region table in the specified Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: capacitySpecification
nested_items.description: The read/write throughput capacity mode for a table. The options are:
throughputMode:PAY_PER_REQUEST and.
throughputMode:PROVISIONED.
